school.name: Full Sail University (FSU)
school.overview: Full Sail University offers campus and online degree programs that are designed for the world of entertainment, media, arts, and technology. Offering associate's, bachelor's, and master's degrees, Full Sail's approach is centered on real-world industry experience and creative problem-solving.
scholarships: Full Sail Entertainment & Media Scholarship for Women, new students, $2,000
Hall of Fame Scholarship, new students, $10,000
Full Sail Merit Scholarship, new students, $3,000
Courage and Creativity Scholarship, new students, $18,500
Full Sail Educational Media Scholarship, new students $12,000
Momentum Scholarship for High School Seniors Scholarship, new students, $20,000
Momentum Scholarship for Florida Residents Scholarship, new students, $20,000
Full Sail Alumni Scholarship, returning students, $3,000

locations.address: 3300 University Boulevard, Winter Park, Florida 32792, USA

school.facilitiesDescription: 212 acre campus featuring 110+ studios and collaborative production environments, professional-level recording and game studios, spacious Hollywood-style back lot, and multiple live venues to host events, concerts, and more.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - AUDIO PRODUCTION
courses.description: This program is designed to encourage independence and entrepreneurial thinking as students learn audio essentials and business skills for the audio production industry.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - RECORDING ARTS
courses.description: Students get the opportunity to experience the different facets of the audio industry, as they develop the skills they need to get their hands on the controls in professional-level recording facilities.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - SHOW PRODUCTION
courses.description: Students in this program build experience at concerts and live shows, becoming familiar with concepts such as lighting and sound design.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - GAME ART
courses.description: This degree program focuses on the fundamentals of interactive graphics development â€“ including character creation, environment and prop creation, the game production pipeline, in-game effects, and animation.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - GAME DESIGN
courses.description: Students learn production processes used by todayâ€™s studios to design and produce games, while studying the building blocks of narrative design.

courses.name: MASTER OF SCIENCE - GAME DESIGN
courses.description: This programâ€™s specialized courses focus on core concepts in teamwork and leadership, project development, design and prototyping, and marketing, as well as grounding in different types of software.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - GAME DEVELOPMENT
courses.description: In this program, students master the technology and tools necessary to develop and program single and multiplayer video games for gaming consoles, personal computers, and networks.

courses.name: MASTER OF SCIENCE - MOBILE GAMING
courses.description: This program allows students to explore the production processes used to produce content for mobile gaming platforms, such as character sketches, level design, story development, and other creative elements.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - COMPUTER ANIMATION
courses.description: In this program, students build traditional art fundamentals while familiarizing themselves with the techniques and technology behind animated projects in media such as film, television, video games and motion graphics.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - DIGITAL ARTS & DESIGN
courses.description: This program combines art fundamentals with the design industryâ€™s current technology â€“ helping students expand their artistic talents to create powerful imagery for entertainment, advertising, branding, and the web.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - GRAPHIC DESIGN
courses.description: Students learn how to meet deadlines and work within specific creative demands while producing high-end design work in a variety of formats.

courses.name: MASTER OF FINE ARTS - MEDIA DESIGN
courses.description: In this program, students go through a full-scale branding project â€“ learning how to identify client needs, develop well-researched creative work, and craft an effective path.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - DIGITAL CINEMATOGRAPHY
courses.description: This program merges the artistic concepts of traditional filmmaking with the technological tools used in everything from independent news gathering and documentary filmmaking, to commercial production and web video.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - FILM
courses.description: Students gain hands-on experience working each position on set on a variety of filmmaking projects, enabling them to get a feel for the role that each crew member plays in production.

courses.name: MASTER OF FINE ARTS - FILM PRODUCTION
courses.description: Students receive an advanced education in behind-the-scenes filmmaking â€“ working in teams to complete real films, while focusing on fundamentals such as storytelling, visual aesthetics, and technical roles.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - CLOUD TECHNOLIGIES
courses.description: This program introduces students to various tools and scripting languages involved in managing software-defined data centers (clouds), and explores topics including security, API use, and system management.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - MOBILE DEVELOPMENT
courses.description: This program teaches students the skills to pursue a future in the growing market of mobile development by teaching them how to concept, code, deploy, and market mobile applications for companies and various organizations.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - SIMULATION & VISUALIZATION
courses.description: This program familiarizes students with the technical and critical thinking skills needed to study, architect, develop, and test simulation and visualization systems.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT
courses.description: This program introduces students to the design, development, and implementation of software-based solutions and products for business, entertainment, and consumer markets.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - WEB DESIGN & DEVELOPMENT
courses.description: This program equips students with the essential software, programming, and design knowledge needed to create dynamic websites to meet client needs.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF FINE ARTS - CREATIVE WRITING FOR ENTERTAINMENT
courses.description: In this program, students hone their writing skills through a variety of exercises, assignments, and projects that prepare them to meet the needs of an industry that is powered by creative visionaries.

courses.name: MASTER OF FINE ARTS - CREATIVE WRITING
courses.description: This program teaches students the necessary skills to pursue professional creative writing careers within the world of entertainment, while exploring the art of storytelling and the language of different media outlets.

courses.name: MASTER OF SCIENCE - INSTRUCTIONAL DESIGN
courses.description: Students explore how to create, improve, and implement multimedia instructional tools that will inspire and engage audiences, while also building a solid instructional design foundation.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - MEDIA COMMUNICATIONS
courses.description: Students build skills in interactive content production and brand development as they learn how to navigate current and emerging media channels.

courses.name: MASTER OF ARTS - NEW MEDIA JOURNALISM
courses.description: This program is designed to give students a practical working knowledge of media delivery channels, allowing them to create the kind of dynamic news content thatâ€™s reaching todayâ€™s audiences.

courses.name: MASTER OF ARTS - PUBLIC RELATIONS
courses.description: This program gives students a solid grasp on the foundations of traditional public relations methods, while also helping them plan, research, execute, and evaluate effective media strategies.

courses.name: MASTER OF SCIENCE - BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE
courses.description: Students learn how to collect, analyze, and interpret Big Data using a variety of tools and technologies â€“ allowing them to demonstrate their abilities as business intelligence professionals.

courses.name: MASTER OF SCIENCE - ENTERTAINMENT BUSINESS
courses.description: Students use case studies and in-depth industry research to gain a better understanding of what makes a successful business thrive in the entertainment world.

courses.name: MASTER OF SCIENCE - INNOVATION & ENTREPRENEURSHIP
courses.description: This program leads students from the initial conceptual stage of a tech or creative product service, all the way to a full-fledged business plan that can be pitched to potential investors.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - INTERNET MARKETING
courses.description: Students learn the fundamentals of marketing, plus the tools and tactics to connect with audiences through all online media channels.

courses.name: MASTER OF SCIENCE - INTERNET MARKETING
courses.description: In this program, students use practical applications and advanced techniques to master search engine optimization, online branding, social networks, and more.

courses.name: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE - MUSIC BUSINES
courses.description: Students learn about roles in the industry through music-specific subjects like artist management, music copyright and publishing, music business models, and concert management.
